body.p: The Anthropic Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open standard that enables developers to build secure, two-way connections between their data sources and AI-powered tools.

You can configure a reference to a model context protocol configuration file in the
Preferences Plugins / Oxygen AI Positron Assistant Enterprise / Model Context Protocol page. The AI Positron utilizes this file to load extra tools that can be called by the AI engine when using the chat modes or when invoking custom AI actions.

dd.p: A reference to a JSON file that configures local or remote MCP servers.

dlentry.dd: The configured timeout for attempts to connect to each server or retrieve content from it.

dlentry.dt: Add provided tools to all chat modes
dlentry.dd: Enabled by default, this option allows all defined chat modes to access the tools provided by the MCP servers during conversations.
Presents the status of each MCP server connection and the tools that have been retrieved from it.
